title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: Causal mediation analysis methods commonly used research studies explore causal pathways linking exposures outcomes. methods aim disentangle total effect exposure direct indirect components. Traditional mediation analysis primarily focuses identifying mechanistic causal pathways assuming pre-existing notion mediation, indirect effects defined accordingly detect quantify mechanisms. However, ultimate goal studies often elucidate extent hypothetical interventions targeting mediators reduce mitigate adverse effects exposure outcome exposed. shifts focus merely understanding underlying mechanisms evaluating hypothetical interventions inform future policy development. Interventional effects (VanderWeele, Vansteelandt, Robins 2014) mediation estimands address key identifiability challenges associated natural effects (Robins Greenland 1992). shown implicitly emulate effects estimated target trials (Hernán Robins 2016) designed assess impact distributional shifts mediators (Moreno-Betancur Carlin 2018). Building , Moreno-Betancur et al. (2021) redefine interventional effects terms hypothetical mediator interventions specific interest, mapping target trial, making particularly useful policy-relevant evaluations applied research.

what: Define interventional effects and estimation methods
title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: Moreno-Betancur et al. (2021) defined several target estimands based hypothetical mediator interventions. vignette, describe estimands corresponding mediator interventions, implemented medRCT R package. type mediator intervention can specified using argument intervention_type. default, intervention_type = "" estimates three types interventional effects. available options : shift_all: estimand corresponds intervention shifts joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. shift_k: estimand corresponds intervention shifts distribution specific mediator exposed match level unexposed, without considering flow-effects mediators. shift_k_order: estimand corresponds intervention shifts distribution specific mediator exposed match level unexposed, considering flow-effects causally descendant mediators. medRCT estimates interventional effects using Monte Carlo simulation-based g-computation approach, described Vansteelandt Daniel (2017). number Monte Carlo simulations can specified using argument mcsim, allowing users balance computational efficiency estimation accuracy. Additionally, medRCT automatically removes missing values dataset, performing complete-case analysis.

what: Getting started with medRCT: Estimating interventional effects
title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: medRCT package designed handle complex mediation settings involving multiple mediators intermediate confounders (exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders). supports range variable types. Specifically, supports categorical exposures two levels (Levels ≥\geq 2). outcome variable, medRCT supports binary continuous outcomes. Additionally, mediator intermediate confounder can either binary continuous. makes package suitable broad range real-world applications epidemiology, public health, social science research. begin illustrating estimate three different types interventional effects presence multiple mediators intermediate confounders. intermediate confounders can specified using argument intermediate_confs. Consider following example using simulated data inspired Longitudinal Study Australian Children (LSAC) (Sanson Johnstone 2004):
code: library(medRCT) #> medRCT: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial #> When estimating the effect type 'shift_k_order', the order of mediators specified in the 'mediators' argument is important.  # Set a seed for reproducibility set.seed(2024) LSACdata = LSACdata[sample(1:nrow(LSACdata), 800),] # Display the first few rows of the dataset head(LSACdata) #>      child_sex child_atsi mat_cob mat_engl mat_age sep fam_stress parent_mh #> 4645         0          0       0        0       1   1          0         0 #> 3629         0          1       0        0       0   1          0         1 #> 4796         1          0       0        0       0   1          0         0 #> 5009         1          0       0        0       0   0          0         0 #> 2669         1          1       0        0       1   1          0         0 #> 3488         0          0       0        0       1   0          0         0 #>      preschool_att child_mh #> 4645             1        0 #> 3629             0        0 #> 4796             0        1 #> 5009             1        1 #> 2669             1        0 #> 3488             0        1  # Define confounders for the analysis confounders <- c("child_sex", "child_atsi", "mat_cob", "mat_engl", "mat_age")  # Define intermediate confounders intermediate_confs <- "fam_stress"  # Estimate interventional indirect effects med_res <- medRCT(   dat = LSACdata,                         exposure = "sep",                       outcome = "child_mh",                   mediators = c("parent_mh", "preschool_att"),    intermediate_confs = intermediate_confs,    confounders = confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = "all",   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   mcsim = 100                           ) #> Conducting complete case analysis, 0 observations were excluded due to missing data.  # Summarise the results summary(med_res) #>  #> Estimated interventional effect:  #>  #>                            Estimate Std. Error  CI Lower  CI Upper p-value #> IIE_1 (p_trt - p_1)        0.002191   0.005509 -0.008803  0.012794    0.69 #> IIE_2 (p_trt - p_2)       -0.001571   0.004164 -0.009702  0.006621    0.71 #> IIE_all (p_trt - p_all)    0.000479   0.007119 -0.013790  0.014117    0.95 #> IIE_1 (p_trt - p_1_prime)  0.001079   0.005881 -0.010825  0.012228    0.85 #> TCE (p_trt - p_ctr)        0.053700   0.035970 -0.021936  0.119065    0.14 #>  #> Estimated expected outcome in each trial arm: #>  #>           Estimate Std. Error CI Lower CI Upper p-value #> p_1         0.3117     0.0335   0.2425   0.3737  <2e-16 #> p_2         0.3155     0.0332   0.2466   0.3767  <2e-16 #> p_all       0.3134     0.0338   0.2436   0.3763  <2e-16 #> p_ctr       0.2602     0.0179   0.2265   0.2966  <2e-16 #> p_trt       0.3139     0.0327   0.2459   0.3742  <2e-16 #> p_1_prime   0.3128     0.0336   0.2436   0.3752  <2e-16 #>  #> Sample Size: 800  #>  #> Simulations: 100

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: argument interactions_XC medRCT allows users specify exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. note, algorithm automatically includes two-way interactions among exposure, mediators, intermediate confounders. interaction terms fixed modified user.

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: default, interactions_XC = "" includes two-way interactions exposure confounders, confounder-confounder interactions excluded.

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: Setting interactions_XC = "none" removes two-way interactions involving exposure confounders.

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: Custom specification: Users can manually specify interaction terms providing model formula format interactions_XC = "exposure:confounder1 + exposure:confounder2". option provides full control interaction terms exposure confounders model, enabling customisation specific research questions.

code: med_res intervention_type = NULL,   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   mcsim = 100 )

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: one mediator, intervention_type shift_k can estimated, options (shift_all shift_k_order) require multiple mediators define meaningful interventional effects.

what: Causal ordering for the estimation of the estimand shift_k_order:
title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: estimating estimand shift_k_order, order mediators specified argument mediators important, defines causal ordering among mediators. ordering determines causal descendants mediator interest, providing essential information accounting flow-effects hypothetical intervention. Specifying incorrect mediator ordering may result biased estimates estimand shift_k_order.

title: Estimating Mediation Effects that Emulate a Target Randomised Controlled Trial
text: developed Shiny application convenient model diagnostics, can launched using command: Within Shiny app, specifying relevant arguments clicking Run medRCT models button, app fit regression models required medRCT algorithm generate detailed summaries models. summaries provide valuable insights model diagnostics, enabling users evaluate model performance detect potential issues. Additionally, warnings error messages encountered model fitting process highlighted app. offering user-friendly interface diagnostic tool, Shiny app streamlines model diagnostics process medRCT algorithm, enabling transparent comprehensive model assessment.
code: medRCT_shiny(dat = data)

what: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Emulate Randomised Controlled Trial R package medRCT supports estimation interventional effects (VanderWeele, Vansteelandt, Robins 2014) defined explicitly terms target trial (Hernán Robins 2016), treatment strategies specified reflect hypothetical interventions, encoded shifts joint distribution mediators (Moreno-Betancur et al. 2021). medRCT can accommodates multiple mediators presence exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders.

title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: medRCT package yet available CRAN. can install latest stable version GitHub using following command:
code: remotes::install_github("T0ngChen/medRCT")

title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial
text: illustrate use medRCT estiamte interventional indirect effects emulate target trail. Specifically, consider hypothetical intervention shifts distribution mediator individually. allows investigation causal pathways quantification indirect effects directly address real-world research questions. Consider following example using simulated data based Longitudinal Study Australian Children (Sanson Johnstone 2004): detailed guidance using package handle complex scenarios, please refer vignette.
code: # Load the medRCT package library(medRCT)  # Set a seed for reproducibility set.seed(2024)  # Display the first few rows of the dataset head(LSACdata) #>   child_sex child_atsi mat_cob mat_engl mat_age sep fam_stress parent_mh #> 1         1          0       0        0       1   1          0         0 #> 2         0          0       0        0       0   0          0         0 #> 3         1          0       1        1       0   0          0         1 #> 4         0          0       0        0       0   0          0         0 #> 5         0          0       0        0       0   0          0         0 #> 6         0          0       0        0       0   1          0         0 #>   preschool_att child_mh #> 1             1        0 #> 2             1        0 #> 3             0        0 #> 4             1        0 #> 5             0        0 #> 6             0        0  # Define confounders for the analysis confounders <- c("child_sex", "child_atsi", "mat_cob", "mat_engl", "mat_age")  # Estimate interventional indirect effects for a hypothetical intervention # that shifts the distribution of each mediator individually med_res <- medRCT(   dat = LSACdata,                         exposure = "sep",                       outcome = "child_mh",                   mediators = c("parent_mh", "preschool_att"),    intermediate_confs = "fam_stress",  # intermediate confounders    confounders = confounders,              bootstrap = TRUE,                       intervention_type = "shift_k",          mcsim = 100                           )  # Summarise the results summary(med_res) #>  #> Estimated interventional effect:  #>  #>                      Estimate Std. Error  CI Lower  CI Upper p-value #> IIE_1 (p_trt - p_1)  0.010075   0.002731  0.005061  0.015409 0.00022 #> IIE_2 (p_trt - p_2)  0.000549   0.001733 -0.002301  0.004548 0.75129 #> TCE (p_trt - p_ctr)  0.106266   0.016395  0.076784  0.141251 9.1e-11 #>  #> Estimated expected outcome in each trial arm: #>  #>       Estimate Std. Error CI Lower CI Upper p-value #> p_trt  0.33345    0.01406  0.31244  0.36755  <2e-16 #> p_ctr  0.22719    0.00765  0.21490  0.24367  <2e-16 #> p_1    0.32338    0.01412  0.30067  0.35502  <2e-16 #> p_2    0.33290    0.01423  0.31124  0.36460  <2e-16 #>  #> Sample Size: 5107  #>  #> Simulations: 100

title: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial

code: @software{Chen2024medRCT,    author = {Tong Chen and Margarita Moreno-Betancur and Ghazaleh Dashti},    title = {medRCT: Causal Mediation Analysis Estimating Interventional Effects Mapped to a Target Trial},    year  = {2024},    url = {https://t0ngchen.github.io/medRCT/},    note = {R package version 0.0.0.9020}    } @article{Moreno2021Mediation,    author = {Margarita Moreno-Betancur and Paul Moran and Denise Becker and George C Patton and John B Carlin},    title = {Mediation effects that emulate a target randomised trial: Simulation-based evaluation of ill-defined interventions on multiple mediators},    journal = {Statistical Methods in Medical Research},    volume = {30},    number = {6},    pages = {1395-1412},    year = {2021}    }

title: Capture Warnings and Errors from Model Fitting — catch_model_messages
text: formula formula specifying model fitted. data data frame containing variables referenced formula. family description error distribution link function used model, specified glm (can either binomial gaussian).

title: Capture Warnings and Errors from Model Fitting — catch_model_messages
text: function uses tryCatch withCallingHandlers handle warnings errors separately. Warnings captured stored resulting model object warnings attribute, errors stored errors attribute. model fits successfully without warnings errors, attributes NULL.

Must either "binomial" "gaussian".

what: Collect All Models fitted by the algorithm — collect_models
title: Collect All Models fitted by the algorithm — collect_models
text: collect_models fits collects models required algorithm.

title: Collect All Models fitted by the algorithm — collect_models
code: collect_models(   data,   exposure,   outcome,   mediators,   intermediate_confs,   confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = c("all", "shift_all", "shift_k", "shift_k_order") )

title: Collect All Models fitted by the algorithm — collect_models
text: data data.frame containing dataset analysis. exposure character string specifying name exposure variable dataset. exposure variable can categorical, 0 explicitly denoting unexposed (control) group. values represent different exposure categories. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable dataset. outcome variable can specified either binary continuous. mediators character vector specifying names mediator variables dataset. mediators can specified either binary continuous. estimating effect type "shift_k_order", order mediators vector important, determines causal sequence mediators. intermediate_confs character vector specifying names intermediate confounders dataset. intermediate confounders can specified either binary continuous. NULL, intermediate confounders specified, natural effect estimated. confounders character vector listing names baseline confounders. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated.

what: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
text: Estimation Conditionals Mediators Exposed

title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
code: con_exposed(   MM,   k,   K,   data,   dat2,   fam_type,   mediators,   interactions_XC,   lnzero,   n )

title: Estimation of Conditionals of Mediators under Exposed — con_exposed
text: MM integer specifying index mediator whose distribution shifted. k integer specifying index current mediator processed. K integer specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. data data.frame containing dataset analysis. dataset used fit model mediators. dat2 data.frame used perform counterfactual predictions random draws. fam_type character string specifying family type modeling. Options typically include "gaussian" continuous variables "binomial" binary variables. mediators character vector including variable names mediators (including intermediate confounders). interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. lnzero numeric vector specifying non-zero levels exposure. n integer specifying number observations dat2.

Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. MM integer (optional) specifying index mediator whose distribution shifted. Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. K integer (optional) specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. Defaults NULL, indicating function generate formulas without explicitly considering parameter. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. include_all Logical. marginal Logical. TRUE, estimating marginals X=0.

what: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: function performs actual causal mediation analysis estimate interventional effects mapped hypothetical target trial.

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
code: medRCT.fun(   dat,   ind = 1:nrow(dat),   first = first,   K = K,   fam_type = fam_type,   mediators = mediators,   interactions_XC = interactions_XC,   intervention_type = intervention_type,   mcsim )

title: Causal Mediation Analysis for Estimating Interventional Effects — medRCT.fun
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. ind vector indices specifying subset dat use analysis. Defaults rows dat. parameter particularly useful using function within boot() function boot package, enables resampling specifying subsets data. first integer specifying index first mediator interest combined list intermediate confounders mediators. K integer specifying total number mediators intermediate confounders. Mediators considered sequentially based order. fam_type character string specifying family type modeling. Options typically include "gaussian" continuous variables "binomial" binary variables. mediators character vector including variable names mediators (including intermediate confounders). interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causal descendent mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform.

what: Causal mediation analysis using interventional effects that map to a target trial — medRCT
title: Causal mediation analysis using interventional effects that map to a target trial — medRCT
text: 'medRCT' used estimate interventional effects map target trial evaluating hypothetical mediator interventions interest. can handle multiple mediators, including primary interest exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders.

title: Causal mediation analysis using interventional effects that map to a target trial — medRCT
code: medRCT(   dat,   exposure,   outcome,   mediators,   intermediate_confs,   confounders,   interactions_XC = "all",   intervention_type = c("all", "shift_all", "shift_k", "shift_k_order"),   mcsim,   bootstrap = TRUE,   boot_args = list(R = 100, stype = "i", ci.type = "norm"),   ... )

title: Causal mediation analysis using interventional effects that map to a target trial — medRCT
text: dat data.frame containing dataset analysis. include variables exposure, outcome, mediators, confounders, exposure-induced mediator-outcome confounders specified analysis. exposure character string specifying name exposure variable dataset. exposure variable can categorical, 0 explicitly denoting unexposed (control) group. values represent different exposure categories. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable dataset. outcome variable can specified either binary continuous. mediators character vector specifying names mediator variables dataset. mediators can specified either binary continuous. estimating effect type "shift_k_order", order mediators vector important, determines causal sequence mediators. intermediate_confs character vector specifying names intermediate confounders dataset. intermediate confounders can specified either binary continuous. NULL, intermediate confounders specified, natural effect estimated. confounders character vector listing names baseline confounders. interactions_XC character string specifying exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interaction terms include regression models confounder adjustment. default value, "", includes two-way exposure-confounder interactions excludes confounder-confounder interactions. Specify "none" exclude two-way exposure-confounder confounder-confounder interactions. intervention_type character string indicating type interventional effect estimated. Options include: "" (default): Estimates types interventional indirect effects. "shift_all": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting joint distribution mediators exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed. "shift_k_order": Estimates interventional indirect effect shifting distribution specific mediator (k) exposed match level unexposed accounting flow-effects causally descendant mediators. mcsim integer specifying number Monte Carlo simulations perform. bootstrap logical value indicating whether bootstrapping performed. TRUE (default), bootstrapping conducted using boot function boot package. boot_args list arguments bootstrapping. default settings : R: Number bootstrap replicates (default: 100). stype: Specifies statistic type passed boot function (default: ""). ci.type: Specifies type confidence interval compute (default: "norm"). ... Additional arguments passed boot function boot package.
